intro: Posoqueria fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered spurge, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy texture. The flowers are small and clustered, with both male and female parts, making it an interesting subject for botanical study.
